definition: a feeling of foolish or obsessively strong love for, admiration for, or interest in someone or something : strong and unreasoning attachment
examples: She speaks openly about the real-life subject of one of her songs, a conservatory teacher who is both a neighbor in her apartment building and the unwilling object of her obsessive infatuation.
Craig Claiborne wrote about it in 1963, when he was deep in his infatuation with dill and meatballs and all things Nordic.

definition: the object of an unreasoning or foolish attachment
examples: And then, I began trying to forge their autographs. I'm not sure why I did it at first, but it became an infatuation.
